snippet: Shira Scheindlin, a federal judge in New York, ruled that a group of fans suing Major League Baseball and the N.H.L. to stop the leagues’ strict control over television broadcast rights can try to prove their claims at trial.
abstract: Federal Judge Shira Scheindlin rules that group of fans suing Major League Baseball and the NHL to stop leagues’ strict control over television broadcast rights can try to prove their claims at trial.
lead_paragraph: Shira Scheindlin, a federal judge in New York, ruled that a group of fans suing Major League Baseball and the N.H.L. to stop the leagues’ strict control over television broadcast rights can try to prove their claims at trial.

headline.main: Fans’ Case against Major League Baseball Heads for Trial
